Package com.univpm.po.NutritionStats.controller

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
com.univpm.po.NutritionStats.controller.Controller
@RestController public class Controller extends Object

This is the RestController, the FIRST step of any client request. It associates each supported request with the correspondent Service method. It is the bridge between the guest and this restful api. Here is where the checked exception thrown by Service are handled with try{}/catch{}. All the endpoint are memorized in final global variables below which are accessed by the methods. These last returns instances of ResponseEntity<Object> containing the HttpStatus and the JsonObject associated with the response.

The HttpStatus is a number referring the type of request result, here is a sample table:

• 200 = OK: if everything went fine.

• 400 = Bad Request: if some parameters are missing, or the request body is incompatible with the request.

• 404 = Not Found: when the requested endpoint is not handled by the server

• 405 = Method Not Allowed: the endpoint does not support this request method, for example when using GET as request method on an endpoint which supports only POST.

• 500 = Internal Server Error: generic error generated due to server internal error.

• 501 = Not Implemented: when the server does not recognize the request method.

The JsonObject contains a list of key-value. They are the message returned to the client; depending on the requested endpoint it may consist in just a notification about a potential error or the plain success, or it may contain data about the user or his data, for example his Metadata, ore some Statistics.

Author:
Morelli Valerio

    • Welcome

      @RequestMapping(path="/") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> Welcome()
      This endpoint is the main route
      Returns:
      new instance of ResponseEntity which contains a simple welcome message.

    • getInfoFromFoodName

      @RequestMapping(path="/api/name/{food_name}", method=GET) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> getInfoFromFoodName(@PathVariable("food_name") String foodName, @RequestParam(value="portion_weight",defaultValue="100") Integer weight, @RequestParam(value="unit_of_measure",defaultValue="GR") Measure measure)

      This endpoint provides a simple communication between the client and Edamam free api, which has a huge database containing nutrition information about a lot of foods.

      As you can see in the MainService class, this endpoint does not always lead to a request to Edamam api; this because EdamamNutritionAnalysisAPI uses Serialization to store the response locally (and backups remotely on a dedicated dropbox account using DropboxAPI) avoiding making the same request in the future. This helps a lot reducing the time needed to fulfill the request of the client.

      /api/name/{food_name} [GET] route.

      Parameters:
      foodName - the name of the food to search
      weight - the portion weight
      measure - the unit of measure [GR, ML]
      Returns:
      new instance of ResponseEntity which contains nutrition details about requested food name if found.
      See Also:
      • EdamamNutritionAnalysisAPI.getFood(String, int, Measure)
      • ApiFoodNotFoundException

    • getInfoFromEan

      @RequestMapping(path="/api/ean/{ean_code}", method=GET) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> getInfoFromEan(@PathVariable("ean_code") Long eanCode)

      This endpoint provides a simple communication between the client and Chomp api, which has a huge database containing nutrition information about a lot of ean codes.

      As you can see in the MainService class, this endpoint does not always lead to a request to Edamam api; this because ChompBarcodeSearchAPI uses Serialization to store the response locally (and backups remotely on a dedicated dropbox account using DropboxAPI) avoiding making the same request in the future. This helps a lot reducing the time needed to fulfill the request of the client. It is also useful to reduce the calls to the api which has a strict limit.

      /api/ean/{ean_code} [GET] route.

      Parameters:
      eanCode - the ean code to search
      Returns:
      new instance of ResponseEntity which contains nutrition details about requested ean code if found.
      See Also:
      • ChompBarcodeSearchAPI.getEanInfo(long)
      • ApiFoodNotFoundException
      • ChompLimitOvercameException

    • requestAddFoodByName

      @RequestMapping(path="/add/food/by_name", method=POST) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> requestAddFoodByName(@RequestParam("token") String token, @RequestParam("day_id") String dayId, @RequestParam("meal_type") MealType mealType, @RequestParam("food_name") String foodName, @RequestParam("portion_weight") Integer portionWeight, @RequestParam(value="unit_of_measure ",defaultValue="GR") Measure measureUnit) throws NoSuchMethodException

      This endpoint is used to add a specified food to the list of consumed foods owned by User

      As you can see in the User class, each user has a list of days where a list of food are stored based on their belonging to meal types.

      /add/food/by_name [POST] route.

      Parameters:
      token - the token used to identify the user
      dayId - the dayId of the day where to put food
      mealType - the type of meal where to put the food
      foodName - the name of the food to add
      portionWeight - the portion of the food to add
      measureUnit - the unit of measure with which the portion value is given [GR, ML]
      Returns:
      new instance of ResponseEntity which contains a message about the error that might occur.
      Throws:
      NoSuchMethodException - when the Java Reflect, which has no guarantee by the compiler that it will find that method, fails runtime.
      See Also:
      • MainService.requestAddFoodByName(String, String, MealType, String, int, Measure)
      • ApiFoodNotFoundException
      • UserNotFound

    • requestAddFoodByEan

      @RequestMapping(path="/add/food/by_ean", method=POST) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> requestAddFoodByEan(@RequestParam("token") String token, @RequestParam("day_id") String dayId, @RequestParam("meal_type") MealType mealType, @RequestParam("ean_code") Long eanCode, @RequestParam("portion_weight") Integer portionWeight) throws NoSuchMethodException

    • requestDiaryInfo

      @RequestMapping(path="/diary", method=GET) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> requestDiaryInfo(@RequestParam("token") String token) throws NoSuchMethodException

      This endpoint is used retrieve all the metadata owned by the User

      These metadata comes from the conversion (made by the framework) of the Diary object of the User in a JsonObject; each public getter has a corresponding key in the response and its value is the value stored by the variable itself.

      /diary [GET] route.

      Parameters:
      token - the token used to identify the user
      Returns:
      new instance of ResponseEntity that provides all the data owned by the user.
      Throws:
      NoSuchMethodException - when the Java Reflect, which has no guarantee by the compiler that it will find that method, fails runtime.
      See Also:
      • MainService.requestDiaryValues(String)
      • UserNotFound

    • requestDayInfo

      @RequestMapping(path="/diary/{day_id}", method=GET) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> requestDayInfo(@PathVariable("day_id") String dayId, @RequestParam("token") String token) throws NoSuchMethodException

      This endpoint is used retrieve all the metadata owned by the User in a specified day

      These metadata comes from the conversion (made by the framework) of the Day object of the Diary owned by the User in a JsonObject; each public getter has a corresponding key in the response and its value is the value stored by the variable itself.

      /diary/{day_id} [GET] route.

      Parameters:
      token - the token used to identify the user
      dayId - the dayId of the requested day
      Returns:
      new instance of ResponseEntity that provides all the data owned by the user in the specified day.
      Throws:
      NoSuchMethodException - when the Java Reflect, which has no guarantee by the compiler that it will find that method, fails runtime.
      See Also:
      • MainService.requestDayValues(String, String)
      • UserNotFound

    • requestSignUp

      @RequestMapping(path="/signup", method=POST) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> requestSignUp(@RequestParam("nickname") String nickname, @RequestParam("email") String email, @RequestParam("birth") String birth, @RequestParam("weight") Integer weight, @RequestParam("height") Integer height, @RequestParam("diet") Diet diet, @RequestParam("gender") Gender gender)

      This endpoint is used to sign up a new User

      When a new User is registered a new Diary is created and serialized locally (and remotely with DropboxAPI) in a file named as the token associated to the new User.

      The token is the encrypt value of the provided email with the md5 hash function.

      This operation fails if the provided email leads to an existing account, in this case a dedicated exception is thrown by the service, and the client is notified.

      /signup [POST] route.

      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the new user
      email - the email of the new user (used to generate the token)
      birth - the birthdate of the new user
      weight - the weight of the new user
      height - the height of the new user
      diet - the diet plan of the new user
      gender - the gender of the new user
      Returns:
      new instance of ResponseEntity which contains a message about the error that might occur or the token associated to the new user if everything went fine.
      See Also:
      • MainService.requestSignUp(User)
      • UserAlreadyInDatabase

    • requestLogin

      @RequestMapping(path="/login", method=GET) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> requestLogin(@RequestParam("token") String token) throws NoSuchMethodException

      This endpoint is used to perform a login

      The service checks if the provided token can be found in the database; if so, some basic data about the user are returned as response to the client.

      /login [GET] route.

      Parameters:
      token - the token used to identify the user
      Returns:
      new instance of ResponseEntity that provides a summary of the user
      Throws:
      NoSuchMethodException - when the Java Reflect, which has no guarantee by the compiler that it will find that method, fails runtime.
      See Also:
      • MainService.requestLogin(String)
      • UserNotFound

    • requestReset

      @RequestMapping(path="/reset", method=DELETE) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> requestReset(@RequestParam("token") String token) throws NoSuchMethodException

      This endpoint is used to delete all the data owned by a User

      This operation is irreversible, everything is deleted. The client may want to start from the beginning.

      /reset [DELETE] route.

      Parameters:
      token - the token used to identify the user
      Returns:
      new instance of ResponseEntity which contains a message about the error that might occur.
      Throws:
      NoSuchMethodException - when the Java Reflect, which has no guarantee by the compiler that it will find that method, fails runtime.
      See Also:
      • MainService.requestReset(String)
      • UserNotFound

    • requestUpdateWeight

      @RequestMapping(path="/update_weight", method=PUT) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> requestUpdateWeight(@RequestParam("token") String token, @RequestParam("weight") Float weight, @RequestParam(value="date",defaultValue="null") String date) throws NoSuchMethodException

    • requestStats

      @RequestMapping(path="/stats", method=POST) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> requestStats(@RequestParam("token") String token, @RequestParam("type") StatisticType[] types, @RequestBody FilterManager filterManager) throws NoSuchMethodException

      This endpoint is used to generate statistics based on the filtered data owned by the User

      Here statistics like the sample mean and the sample variance are calculated and provided to the client.

      The client can also filter the data with which the statistics are being calculated with on appropriate request json body:

      • Start Date: the left period range extremity.

      • End Date: the right period range extremity.

      • Meal Type: the type of meals in which the client is interested.

      • Water: if the client wants statistic on his water assumption.

      • Nutrient Name: a list of nutrients on which the statistics will be calculated

      /stats [POST] route.

      Parameters:
      token - the token used to identify the user
      types - an array of StatisticType containing all the statistic in with the client is interested
      filterManager - the body of the request, containing all the parameters about the filter
      Returns:
      new instance of ResponseEntity which contains all the values of all the statistics requested.
      Throws:
      NoSuchMethodException - when the Java Reflect, which has no guarantee by the compiler that it will find that method, fails runtime.
      See Also:
      • MainService.requestStats(String, StatisticType[], ArrayList)
      • StatisticType
      • FilterManager
      • UserNotFound
      • EndDateBeforeStartDateException

    • requestFilter

      @RequestMapping(path="/filters", method=POST) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> requestFilter(@RequestParam("token") String token, @RequestBody FilterManager filterManager) throws NoSuchMethodException

      This endpoint is used retrieve filtered metadata owned by the User

      The client can filter the data on appropriate request json body:

      • Start Date: the left period range extremity.

      • End Date: the right period range extremity.

      • Meal Type: the type of meals in which the client is interested.

      • Water: if the client wants statistic on his water assumption.

      • Nutrient Name: a list of nutrients on which the statistics will be calculated

      /filters [POST] route.

      Parameters:
      token - the token used to identify the user.
      filterManager - the body of the request, containing all the parameters about the filter.
      Returns:
      new instance of ResponseEntity which contains all the filtered data owned by the user.
      Throws:
      NoSuchMethodException - when the Java Reflect, which has no guarantee by the compiler that it will find that method, fails runtime.
      See Also:
      • MainService.requestFilters(String, ArrayList)
      • FilterManager
      • UserNotFound
      • EndDateBeforeStartDateException
